adm:managed-object.name: file-based-http-access-log-publisher
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis: publish HTTP access messages to the file system.

adm:property.name: asynchronous
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Indicates whether the
will publish records asynchronously.

adm:property.name: queue-size
adm:property.adm:synopsis: The maximum number of log records that can be stored in the asynchronous queue.
adm:property.adm:description: Setting the queue size to zero activates parallel log writer implementation which has no queue size limit and as such the parallel log writer should only be used on a very well tuned server configuration to avoid potential out of memory errors.

adm:other.adm:synopsis: The must be restarted if this property is changed and the asynchronous property is set to true.

adm:property.name: log-file
adm:property.adm:synopsis: The file name to use for the log files generated by the . The path to the file is relative to the server root.

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: A path to an existing file that is readable by the server.

adm:property.name: log-file-permissions
adm:property.adm:synopsis: The UNIX permissions of the log files created by this .

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: A valid UNIX mode string. The mode string must contain three digits between zero and seven.

adm:property.name: time-interval
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the interval at which to check whether the log files need to be rotated.

adm:property.name: buffer-size
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the log file buffer size.

adm:property.name: auto-flush
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies whether to flush the writer after every log record.
adm:property.adm:description: If the asynchronous writes option is used, the writer is flushed after all the log records in the queue are written.

adm:property.name: append
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies whether to append to existing log files.

adm:property.name: rotation-policy
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
The rotation policy to use for the
.
adm:property.adm:description: When multiple policies are used, rotation will occur if any policy's conditions are met.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: No rotation policy is used and log rotation will not occur.

adm:property.name: retention-policy
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
The retention policy to use for the
.
adm:property.adm:description: When multiple policies are used, log files are cleaned when any of the policy's conditions are met.

adm:alias.adm:synopsis: No retention policy is used and log files are never cleaned.

adm:property.name: log-format
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies how log records should be formatted and written to the HTTP access log.

adm:defined.adm:value: cs-host c-ip cs-username x-datetime cs-method cs-uri-query cs-version sc-status cs(User-Agent) x-connection-id x-etime

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis:
A space separated list of fields describing the extended log format to be used for logging HTTP accesses. Available values are listed on the W3C working draft http://www.w3.org/TR/WD-logfile.html and Microsoft website http://www.microsoft.com/technet/prodtechnol/WindowsServer2003/Library/IIS/676400bc-8969-4aa7-851a-9319490a9bbb.mspx?mfr=true
OpenDJ supports the following standard fields: "c-ip", "c-port", "cs-host", "cs-method", "cs-uri-query", "cs(User-Agent)", "cs-username", "cs-version", "s-computername", "s-ip", "s-port", "sc-status".
OpenDJ supports the following application specific field extensions: "x-connection-id" displays the internal connection ID assigned to the HTTP client connection, "x-datetime" displays the completion date and time for the logged HTTP request and its ouput is controlled by the "ds-cfg-log-record-time-format" property, "x-etime" displays the total execution time for the logged HTTP request.

adm:property.name: log-record-time-format
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the format string that is used to generate log record timestamps.

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: Any valid format string that can be used with the java.text.SimpleDateFormat class.
